title: Considerations when working with data from multiple third parties
Establishing the suitability of data prior to access and reuse
displayTitle: Establishing the suitability of data prior to access and reuse
body:
As a user of the third-party data, beyond obtaining permission to reuse the data, you will need to check the practical reusability of the data.

This is a complex phase that could take a significant amount of time. Before acquiring the data it may well be possible to ascertain some of the ethical risks relating to the data including:

title: Who owns personal data?
body:
To understand what rights people have over personal data, it is important to first understand who owns it.

When you put intellectual effort (thought) into creating something, you own that work and you have certain intellectual property rights. It is critically important to understand what intellectual property rights are when you are seeking to collect, use and share data.
